CatDescriptText: Stanley Brown, restaurant worker, Homewood and Mary Williams, Broadhead Manor, were part of the Pittsburgher's Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 18, 1960 with question: "Do you think that economic status, race, or religion influences court decisions in civil and criminal cases?" Stanley Brown's answer reads: "The majority of times the verdicts are based on the facts and not on the other factors."  Mary Williams' answer reads: "Sometimes, I wonder...in many of the cases, which I've read about in the papers it seems that the juries should have taken a much closer look."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Stanley Brown wearing light colored short sleeve button down collared shirt, standing on Liberty Avenue across from the Jenkins Arcade, Downtown; Portrait of Mary Williams wearing floral dress with v-shaped neckline, standing on liberty Avenue across from the Jenkins Arcade, Downtown
